body.section: The IHTSDO Workbench IDE Framework enables structured data checks to occurring concept creation, and at commit time. These data checks can be made optional, and only provide a warning message, or they can be made mandatory and the user will be unable to commit changes while a particular data check fails.

shows an example of data checks that have identified unedited default values that are currently uncommitted. These data check warnings are presented without the use of modal dialogs, and are therefore less intrusive to the user. At commit time, if the data checks have not been resolved, a modal dialog is presented to the user, and the commit is unable to continue.

fig.title: Dynamic data validation checks are performed and presented to the user in an IHTSDO Workbench IDE.
